title: Tiffin Top
review: This name has been assigned as people used to sit at Dorothy's seat at top of hill for lunch.

title: Just a spot with good view
review: For the people visiting Nainital this is a nice place to get a good view of the hills, which they would be missing in the present condition of Nainital. Among the disappearing natural beauty from Nainital, this is the only place left. However if one can travel a little distance away from the crowded city, there are many such places which offer far better view.

title: Nothing to see! Don't get fooled..
review: There is absolutely nothing new or good to see at this point. You will feel looted when you go there by painful horse ride, paying Rs. 810 for 5 -15 mins stop. Even most hotels or any general place will have better view.

title: Good for Trekking. View from Top is Average.
review: To reach the top of Dorothy's Seat you can either walk or you can hire a mule or Horse at the cost of Rs 750 each (as in 2017). If you are planning to trek up to the top make sure you have a bottle of water and you are wearing comfortable pair of shoes. But be warned - trekking is really tiring as the distance from base to top is long, slope is steep and full of gravels and boulders. Very rocky footpath. After reaching top you can enjoy the view, sip hot cup of tea or coffee, have something to nibble, that's it. Tiffin is all about this. Don't expect any out of the world experience there. If for some reason, you miss it, don't lose heart. Its just a hill top with a beautiful natural hill top view, just like any other hill top view. But still, if you have time, you must visit. Its fun.

title: Enjoy the Horse Ride
review: I had been here with my family . You get horses to explore this [lase, its a small hill with greenery. It takes around 90 mins to go up and get down. It is advice only if you want to experience the horse ride.

title: The view is ruined now.
review: We had high hopes for this view ,but the commercialization of the nearby areas has ruined the view.It may have been beautiful initially when the nearby mountain tops were not populated . Now you can make out that it's all habaited. It takes away most of the fun

title: Great views
review: From this place you will be having great views of Nainital and it's surroundings. Try to get to this place on horse back.

title: Beautiful journey on horseback!
review: Reaching Dorothy's Seat on horseback and riding through the forests in itself was a magical experience. The views from out there are amazing.

title: beautiful views
review: A small trek takes you to this place and the effort to trek to this place is worth it. This place offers a beautiful birds-eye view of Nainital. The trek itself is beautiful.

title: Amazing view
review: Walked early morning at 7 before the horses and people started

title: Tiffin Top is not Dorothy's Seat.
review: Dorothy's Seat is a good one hour walk from the flats,the center of this small picturesque town.

title: Useless going to Tiffin top
review: You buy a ticket for your family with an idea that you will get to see more scenic beauty on tiffin top, but alas ! You only get to see poorly maintained dhabas serving you snacks tea cold drinks but they have BLOCKED ALL THE VALLEY VIEW FOR WHGOD'S SAKE ! Couldn't that construction be planned in such a way that it does not block valley and lake view ? Why did'nt govt authorities take care that tourist does not come all the way up to have tea coffee, they come up to enjoy view and nature. So it is a total waste of money going up in trolley when you dont have the valley view instead you are surrounded by dhaba waalas.

title: naini lake from the highest point
review: This point has the best view of naini lake from the top .. The whole of lake and city can be seen from here . There is no ticket so travellers can enjoy the view on a free basis .. Own vehicles can get here otherwise taxis are always available . Make sure to book a taxi on a bargain rate .. Taxi drivers are totally fraud so be alert ..

title: Amazing views
review: Walking up is better  than taking thise horses. Cafe there is basic but nice. Have bun omelette .......

title: worhty trip
review: We felt like we are in heaven, we were in between ️,clouds were wandering to and fro touching us,we felt as our clothes got moist there ,views there were amazing,at places fog was so much dense that we couldn't see anything beyond.awesome place.

title: Ok area
review: you can visit it, just a peak nothing specific. if you have already been to mountain and peaks then its same.

title: Picnic with friends
review: Its a good place to have a good view of the nainital town and surrounding, Fresh air nice forest around. The best way to reach here is by foot , this gives you a chance to soak in the fresh air and nature around.

title: Lovely view...
review: At this point you find a lovely mountain view and this place is very eye-catching....If you are fun loving and adventures than must go....

title: Breathtaking views
review: You can up here with a trolley and the view from the trolley and once you get up there is amazing. There might be a long wait for the trolley so plan in advance. if you have a guide, you can ask him to arrange tickets. If the sky is clear you can clearly see the snow capped mountains, I wasn't so lucky unfortunately. There is not much to do here other than the view, unless things have changed since my last visit. The "food court" didn't offer much, and the kids play area looked quite unsafe.

title: Nice place but on horseback
review: We started our sightseeing from this place. From horse stand one can hire at 810/- per person. They provide one fellow between two horses.

title: Nice spot
review: This is popular among the locals for picnics. It is surrounded by trees & we can enjoy a day out with family & friends.

title: Tiffin top
review: Tiffin top is one of the best view to see the himalayas from nainital, it is just five kilometres  from nainital

title: Excellent hike with the best view of the lake below!
review: What a stunner of a place! Great hike up from the madness of the town below. not frequented by too many people. Has an old world charm to it since it has existed for over 100 years now. Ac certain Dorothy- missus of a British man used to sit here and paint. You also get horse rides once you're on the top. The view of the town from Dorothy's Seat is a marvel.

title: flat topped hill
review: this is another hill above the lake which is flat at the top and has a picnic spot at the top. it can be reached only by trekking up

title: totally not worth it
review: There is nothing at the top. No views of himalayas, snow peaks or clear view of nainital city. Ticket of ropeway is 230 for an adult, way expensive as there is nothing much at the top.

title: just another hill top
review: A flat area of land on the top of hill.

title: Nice picnic spot
review: Like other places it also offers good view of nainital from the top. It takes approximately one hour to reach the top. It is advisable to carry some food items along with you as      everything is costly on the top.

title: Must visit in Nainital
review: This place is must visit in Nainital. We could able to ride Tiffin top by Horse riding, which is very much adventurous. On the way we halted on the place named 'lands end'. The place Tiffin top is like heaven on Earth.

title: Great morning view
review: Loved this view. Mountain. this place is going to get you probably the best view and the best experience of the true beauty

title: Not a very special point.
review: I was here during my Nainital trip.

title: Anniversary celebration
review: It's a must visit who loves adventure . As the entire trip is through horse and the top view of Himalayas mountain is just amazing . Once journey of nainital is incomplete without going to this place ..

title: Too high giving good view of city down
review: It wasn’t an easy task to reach this place by horses

title: Amazing Place Gathered with Green
review: The best view place. Amazing Street and view of mother Nature is mesmerizing. High court and Himalayan View Point are also there. Roads are very clean and i would suggest to go for walks as taxi charges too much, and by walking you will feel the best. Nature

title: Heaven In Nainital
review: If you are going to Tiffin Top then don't go by horse, just start trecking from nainital it's about a 3 hours treck and you will have the craziest experience while trecking. THE roads are amazing you will enjoy the view and might see a deers if you are lucky BTW I saw a small deer and the view from top is amazing you will have the view of entire nainital., Himalayas, Nani lake and I we also get to see the school of Amitabh bachan and the pleasent weather made me spend some extra time with the place. Just look at the pictures I have clicked.

title: Tiffin top!!!
review: The tiffin top is superb and fantastic place to visit.  The view was very excellent  and photography view was good.

title: Mind blowing
review: We arrived at The lover's point, and the agents tried to convince us to hire a horse to the top costing 810 rupees, but we opted to trek our way up to the top and we chose right. Nice trek in nature, though tiring one, but worth the view from top. Just supperb.

title: Great view
review: The horse ride could be uncomfortable for some while being adventurous for others. Those who can may prefer to walk both ways. Its good. Ensure you are clear about the charges before you hop on for a ride. The place if full of touts. Should take a good 2-3 hours. The top offers a very good view of one of the best hill stations in the country.

title: Not worth it
review: Yes if you're visiting Nainital then you could visit this point. We went on horseback to the point...!

title: Worth the climb!
review: There are two ways to reach Tiffin Top, One is from the normal entry where in you can take a horse to help you climb to the top and the second which was recommended by our driver is a trek through the forests which is close to the nearby Jungle camp resort.

title: Good view of Nainital
review: Must visit point, this gives you the best spot to view Nainital. Also if you trek or take the horse ride from barapathar - the journey is amazing through the thick forest. You will be transformed into a different world altogether.

title: Trek
review: Had awesome trekking for around 30 minutes . Got to meet mountain dog .. worth for getting the awesome view . Feeling so close to the sun... will share more pics...

title: Nice Views ...
review: Since my wife n me love to trek, we went walking all the way up to Tiffin top, enjoying the beautiful nature.

title: Not worth if you have kids n old age parents
review: One way to reach this place it either you go by walk or horse.

title: View was good but the horses were horrible
review: A great place to view, but be careful of the horses you choose. We have taken 2 horses for each of us. initially two persons came to guard each horse, but when we went for a mile distnace the person told if you want each guard for each horse then we have to pay 300 extra. that was rediculous. and the horse scared me all the way and after reacing to the top if was in a scary mode. the way was very slope and horse was out of control at one instance. Better not to go by horse to this place. All the peaks in nainital would be same.

title: Day walk out
review: The way up is through a lovely untouched jungle. We spotted pheasants and spur fowl.

title: Great acclimatisation walk
review: Good three hour walk up to Tiffin Top, views were superb of the lake & Himalayan foothills. Plenty of black faced monkeys en route, avoid & discourage eye contact.

title: Tiffin Top is a peak at Nainital city.
review: Tourist can view a glimpse of Himalayas range with snow over it, recently it was in media for a world record where a tourist snapped a panoramic view of Himalayas range covered almost 9 peak in single shot.

title: A beautiful trek !
review: A visit to Tiffin Top offers a beautiful trek of about 4 kms. through forests of pine, oak & deodar, which stands firm breathing a peaceful silence, only to be broken now & then, by the occasional footsteps of horses carrying visitors to the top & the chirping of crickets or the distant birdsong.

title: only the horse ride is exciting!!
review: The place is average as this is just another hill top from where you can have a beautiful view of the valley, however I enjoyed the horse ride a lot to reach the top.

title: Peak
review: This place is just hard to describe  you'll  get to see the beautiful nature once you reach there.

title: Great view of nature from the spot
review: If you want to enjoy some scenic views, Tiffin Top is a good place to visit. This place can be reaches by horses but I'll recommend trekking. Best time to visit is early in the morning. View from there is quite breathtaking.

title: BEAUTY SPOT
review: though a tough trekking, the result is amazing awesome views all around and you wont regret the trouble taken.

title: It is ok
review: One has to hire a horse to go there which costs Rs 760/- per person. It is not worth of money as well as time it takes. Horse riding is not a fun for such a long and scary route for a non horse-rider individual.

title: On the top in the sky
review: A marvelous place as seems top of the world though top of Nainital. The Himalayan scenic beauty can be seen all around and full of nature.

title: A good place to visit
review: A attractive place in Nainital. I have visited this in April and we have to go through horses. The view is amazing we can see Nainital easily from there.

title: Like Horse Riding.. go there
review: Probably this is one of the most highest point from where you can see Nainital, a 360 degree panoramic view. I was little scare about horse riding. But it  went smooth. Try this when sky is clear.

title: Clouds under your Arm
review: What a amazing trip we enjoyed at tiffin top. We choose to climb it rather than horse riding and decision was right. Our local friend guides us to reach on the top. At there we enjoyed hot Maggi and scenic beauty of tiffin top. Playing with snow was so good.

title: Good Trek
review: It will take roughly an hour to get there by horse. There are 3 points enroute Lands end point-Tiffin top-Dorothy Seat. panoramic view of Nainital is offered from here. Horse owners have a fixed 760/- price. Trek is mesmerizing. It would be good in the morning as well. For evening don't be so late. If you are physically fit than try it by trekking. It is roughly 3-3.5 km one way. One side you can see nainital city and other side you can have khurpa tal view from the top. In clear day one can see himalayan peak also.

title: Excellent Place to chill out
review: Been there by recommendation of one of the local guy, and it was worth visiting. You can reach there either by horse ride or through a 1.5 km walk trail. Place is surrounded by oak trees and  you can also get some good maggie from those small canteen.

title: Adventurous
review: Can b reached by a bumpy horse ride.

title: Camp sparrow Trip
review: Amazing trip... Going this time with family members also. Going to explore more in Holi weekend March 2017.

title: Best Place
review: Tiffin Top is a hilltop at a height of 2292 m and is around 6 km away from Mallital. Popularly known as Dorothy's Seat, this spot is dedicated to an English artist called Dorothy Kellet. I loved this place a lot.

title: Place not to be missed...
review: Must visit place in Nainital. One can walk or can go on horse's back. It is a beautiful nature walk through the jungle. The top is known as Dorothy's seat, gives you a panoramic view of Nainital. During the season time you have lots of visitors... there are couple of restaurants serving fast food. ..

title: Good place to trek...
review: Good place for a small outing and trek. Horse rides are available to and fro but not advisable. In fact, be alert because they will try to fleece you with higher charges and also male riders have to ride the horse on their own. Best to avoid horse ride, if you don't really need to.

title: Nice spot
review: this is on very high altitude.  but we enjoyed as one time experience.  there are few small spots where you really enjoy.

title: It was worth riding on horses to reach it
review: We went with Family riding on the horses to reach this place. Once we reach the Doroth's seat, it was really beautiful. You can see entire Nainital city from this place and weather was awesome. We loved it.

title: Hill Top Restaurant
review: This restaurant is located at the top of a hill and is just mind-boggling. The waiters also serve here nicely and staff is very polite

title: Amazing view
review: Could be reached by trekking (good experience) or by horse ride (equally good)

title: its all about the skyline
review: if you are visiting nainital, you shouldn't miss this place.good skyline nice view and the sunset from here is just mesmerizing.

title: worth a visit
review: a trip thru nature trail on horseback. there is no motorable road and this trip can be done on horseback or walk.horse takes around 2 hrs and trek is likely to take 4 hrs.the ride takes you thru lush green hill sides and vantage view points. view from dorothy's seat is the high point of the ride. the ride costs rs750 per head.highly recommended for nature lovers.

title: Horse Ride till peak
review: This is a tourist attraction for Nainital visitors, people prefer to go on this hill top by Horses, although one can walk. View from here is good.

title: Must Vist Place
review: Easily accessible by horse, Ficed price of 700 Rs, they will show you 7 points on the way.

title: Worth the hassle
review: The views are magnificent. The horse ride is good. If you are on more than one horse, they take a guide fee of Rs. 60 per horse. But  after a few metres, one of the guides will return and there will only be one guide for two horses. It costs 760 per horse. Children above 3 may have to take a separate horses. The horses looked healthy and well-kept. Tiffin top view is amazing.

title: Has good view but getting there is tough.
review: There are two ways of getting there.

title: Great
review: Simply great place in the city I just loved the place from the Nature in it and just one thing want to say about this place is Beauty

title: Best on a near blue sky day..
review: Once you are at the top, all the effort to reach the top would seem worth it ! The skyline is amazing, particularly on a  clear sky/ blue sky day. The view of the valley is breathtaking! It takes about 2 hours to go up and come down, on horse. Trekking may take bit longer, it's about 3 + km of trek, at places quite steep.  We were here on a very cold day, it was such a great fun! I would think that it's okay to spend money on the horse, it adds to the local economy !

title: Useless Place
review: This place is useless where you will left with hefty of amount paid without any return, I am sure I will not go to this place ever its simply wastage of time and money.

title: Good Trek to Tiffin Top
review: Trek is refreshing. Can walk through good flora , good scenery. view from the top is really breathtaking.  Return from top can be on Horse back/Mule some way if you want to experience it. Worth the visit

title: View : 3.5/5 , Horse Ride till Top 5/5
review: View from top is really good. You can see whole Nainital amid fresh air and superb mountains. It feel refreshing. But for me highpoint is Horse Ride . Will remember Bella and Michael (Our Horses) forever. Bella The quite and self-guided horse and Michael the young and sometimes bit risky Horse.  But its almost 6-7 Kms ride ((to & fro) and its filled with adventure, fear, fun and fresh air. Its costly Rs 760 /- per head but in the end you will feel that cost justifes the distance you cover on Horses.Generally a ride of few meters cost us hundreds.  Mean while mid-way you get a chance to enjoy Zipliner. Don't go for it it waste of money or negotiate heavily. Because zipline is very short (150 mts). Still if you want to try it as experience then do it but negotiate heavily. They ask 250-300 but dosen't felt it should cost more than 100. For Zipliner go to Neemrana Rajasthan.  So overall best Horse Ride and Nice views. I will suggest it for Horse Ride with an experienced guide but be brave as it looks risky when horses try to run. But they are trained so worth a try. ;-)  Complete trip should  take nearly 1.5 hrs to 2 hrs.

title: Enjoy the nature with horse riding or tracking ..
review: We can go at the top by tracing or horse riding , we choose horse riding and our experience was Osama ..

title: highly disappointing
review: this is probably a very disappointing experience in nainital. you want to go to tiffin top however, the only way to get there is on a horse and the horse ride costs you 700 per head, not worth it.

title: Highest pick point of Nainital
review: To reach at Tiffin top you must go through horse ride which is most thrilling experience due to small & hilly road made of stones. It is top station from you can see awesome view of nainital.

title: Vantage Point In Nainital
review: Located on the Ayarpatta hills,Tiffin top is a famous vantage point in the scenic hill station of Nainital.This picnic spot is fondly known as Dorothy's Seat,in the loving memory of the eminent painter Kellet Dorothy.Paradise for a nature enthusiast.

title: A good morning trek
review: I saw many people opting for horse riding, even read the same. But after talking to the hotel guy, we decided to trek as it wasn't that long. Being physically active, it was not a challenge though.

title: Exhilirating
review: Don't think I went right to the top but the views of the Himalayas from where the traders are set up was fantastic and the air felt so clean and fresh. Go early, before the rush!

title: Adventurous trip....
review: Horses ride is there to go tiffin top.....  And believe me it was really adventurous .In starting my horse was walking towards trench and my eye were always looking for tree to hold if I fall that day my heart was in hands...but slowly I started enjoying....and I got friendly with badshah(my horse's name). But the view from tiffin top was really awesome as view of the himalaya was also there including all great schools of Nainital. Worth going there .

title: Tiffin Top
review: A great horse ride to the tiffin top. Nainital horse rides are one of the best maintained. even kids can travel. great scenic views all along the journey.

title: Awsome views and a good horse ride
review: You start from the starting point on a horse for a 45min ride . The first point is lands end . The second point is tiffin top and the last point is Dorothy seat from which you can get a good bird eye view of nainital lake, Raj bhavan , st Joseph school etc.

title: Excellent view of nature...
review: Tiffin top offers one of the best view of the lust green and the high altitude hills of Kumaon. Tiffin top is a must for every travel iternary for Nainital. A lot of local vendors are available to provide fooding facilities at this place making the entire viewing of hills and natural beauty a divine and pleasurable experience.

title: Great hike
review: Me and my boyfriend had an amazing hike up here, view was amazing. You can also get up there by horse but i think you will appreciate the view more if you did manual labour.

title: good trek , families can use the horses with guides
review: We trekked when it was snowing . it was worthwhile as the view was worth . U can get a good quality digital photo with thee mountains as background when you reach the top . Hot maggi can be availed a the top . Families can use the horses with the guides to trek , but safety based on your discretion as to not to scare the  horses. Guide are young teenage boys only

title: Average
review: Can't be compared with any view point of North Sikkim or even north Bengal. Very average. Rope way view is even better. Except rope way, naina devi temple, boating at naini lake. 2 night stay is just enough at Nainital. City is also not clean.

title: More for the journey than the destination
review: Like it holds true in most places... It stands truer for nainital than any other place. The charm is in exploring the short cuts the charm lies in walking through trails between the homes of the locals the high steps to the top.  The warm tiny springs here and there.

title: Good for the Trekking, Less for the spot
review: Trekking all the way is the main highlight for this spot in nainital, few kms and you already feel the thirst to reach to the top. local culture and scenic beauty during the trek is what keeps you going all the time. little disappointed for the main spot though, as i couldn't relate to the hunger for this place before. an OK for the destination but visiting this place can be fun since there is not much to do in nainital anyway besides enjoying the weather and scenery.

title: Great View after a small trek
review: This is a view point of Nainital. You need to trek for around 3 kms to reach the view point. For people who are not ready to trek, there is another adventurous option of taking a horse ride to the top.

title: Awesome place to visit
review: After a 4kms horse ride we can reach the place where we can get the complete view of the Nainital lake. The horse riding itself was really a different experience to us. The view at the top was beyond the words.

title: Nice picturistic nature view
review: I went to this point by house ride in nainital. Its basically a nice view point around the nainital hills.

title: the city view
review: tiffin top is the topmost site where we can saw all the nainital area..But it is worst to ride up to their if the climate was cloudy because nothing can be seen from there. U can go there by Horse or can walk we choose walk and our decision was fruitful.

title: Nice Views from the ropeway and the top
review: This is popular attraction for those who like to take trek to the top or use the ropeway. Tickets and queues can be long wait. They also have some fair at the base (appu ghar) for the kids.

title: Awesome place to visit
review: Tiffin top is great place to visit with family. The peak is really really high and can see most of naintal parts.... The weather their is really cool and mindblowing also we can see cloud near us.....

title: lovely view
review: dorothy;s seat is another cool attraction in nanintaal which you will like, its amazing scenic beauty will lure you

title: Good view from the view point on a clear day
review: The only way to reach this view point/ Tiffin Top is via the horse ride. The ride to Tiffin Top is little steep but the path to the view point is like travelling inside forest. My horse guide was not that great, he was wantedly making the horse to run. The guide does not give lot of time to spend there as they are keen only on taking their next safari.. Once you reach the view point, there is small shop where you get maggi and other snacks and drinks. there were other guides who were allowing their customers to spend time in the shop for snacks and drinks.

title: Natural view
review: Dorothy's seat is another cool place to visit in nainital. The natural view of this hill will fall in love with nature.

title: Advancture
review: this point is great advancher for hource riding this is sichuted top of hill minimam 2 to foure hours by jungal road reach tifin top by hours

title: close to nature
review: u have reach there on horses only espeacilly during rainy days path is muddy take half hour on horse .peaceful carm place  at the top  of hills with a full view of nanital and clouds seems to lower than u, prefer  not to visit on cloudy day

title: It is plain area where you can have tiffin or snacks. You have to do walk on mountain or by riding through horses
review: It is plain area where you can have tiffin or snacks. You have to do walk on mountain or by riding through horses

title: Amazing panoramic view of Nainital !!
review: The Tiffin Top of Dorothy's seat if the highest point in the Nainital city. The entire panoramic view of the city and the Nainital lake is awesome.

title: this place can be visited by trolly as well as by car very high place and good for childerens  restaurent ar available
review: dresses are avaible for girls and boys for photography tickets for trolly are taken from booking point in advance

title: Nice Treck
review: Its a nice treck uphill and a view of the plains beyond the hills. Nothing much to see apart from feeling the thrill of being on top of the hill.

title: Must visit place
review: I enjoyed this place while walking, as you get to see Nature and feel as if you are on top (walking in a Jungle).

title: Nice point
review: I visited this place along with my friend but to may bad luck, we were not able to get great view as nothing was visible and smoke was all around due to Utrakhand forest fires

title: Awesome point
review: The way to reach Tiffin Top is beautiful and the view from the top is amazing.This is a must visit place for all. This hill top is a perfect spot for aspiring photographers as they can capture the picturesque view of the countryside. You Can Visit Tiffin - Dorothy’s Seat On Foot By Or By Horseback.

title: Can see himalayan peaks
review: We went on a foggy day, so couldn't see much, but its a great high-altitude and trilling ride by the cab-drvers who race on those 45-deg inclide narrow lanes of the hill.

title: superb place
review: its amazing place for adventure and nature. we were go by horse and return back by walking. if u want to see the beauty of that place then return by walking. its a place where u can see whole nainital . beautiful place foe photography.

title: Super Excellent
review: Its one of the beautiful peak around Nainital. Excellent place for trakking and see the natural beauty. You can go there by horse or by foot. Not a place for car lovers. Recommended place to visit.

title: Give it a miss
review: It takes about 1-1.5 hrs round-trip and the view from the top is not really worth. We did it on the foot so took half an hour extra. Skip it.

title: A must visit for any trekker
review: Like any other hill station, Nainital too has its own share of great peaks to trek. Tiffin top is one such place. Since we stayed in Naini retreat, we started around 8.10a and did a quick trek and were back to the hotel for breakfast by 9a. I would say that its better to go there early morning as its a bit easier to trek when the sun is not bright. t the top, there isn't much to do other than having maggie or clicking some pics.

title: Nice view of nainital from the top 🔝
review: We did an early morning trek to the top.  It was amazing.  Trek from camp side.  Would take around 30-40 min.  The view from the top worth it.

title: View is great
review: It is at the top of the hill and view of Nainital is just great from top. You can ride horses as well to reach at top.

title: Ok place can avoid
review: Ok place can be avoided specially if you and family are not at all comfortable on horses bumpy rides as it is the only way to reach there.

title: Not that good
review: You get to see same view from these place too. Horse riders rush to you n attack for all possible deals. You get foul smell as many horses are standing there doing their natural chores. If you choose to go for hiking it can be good place. But again why would anyone choose hiking at such a crowdy place?

title: approach path was terrible
review: Its scary to go up there with lots of wild bushes etc on the way. best avoided & best experienced on your cellphones / computers.

title: Horse not worth
review: Agree I got the first chance to ride a horse .. Overall not worth due to bad path conditions..  rs  710 for the horse ride. But they will do all natak  to have extra ..better to trek rather than horse ride .. Was more painful to go with 5 yr kid due to space on horse

title: An awesome view point!
review: We went up to the tiffin top by horses. The ride was a bit tricky n bumpy but it was a good experience. The view of naini lake from the top is awesome. You can also do a rope way for a shorter distance at the top if you feel like to.

title: Average trip
review: This place needs to be develop further...Path which goes on top is very bad n seems no body cares about it...Horse riding is too costly which takes 700 Rs per horse.

title: Bird's Eye View of Nainital
review: Tiffin Top or Dorothy seat offers a bird's eye view of the whole of Nanital and Naini Lake. We reached there after a pony ride up the hills. The view it offers is simply majestic.

title: Definitely must visit
review: This place is inaccessible through any vehicle. The only option is the hire a horse [Rs.700 per person] or to walk. Horse ride has some 6 points, one of them being this. The view from Tiffin top is simply breath taking. The horse ride also takes you to Lands End which gives a birds eye view of the Khurpatal.

title: Amazing view but visit on a clear day
review: Don't go if its raining,there are two ways to reach there, either by foot(hit the track) or take the horse, taking a horse would be better.The way to reach Tiffin Top is beautiful and the view from the top is amazing.This is a must visit place for all types of travellers be it family or friends.

title: rock top like tiffin box
review: at vry high point in nainital can b visited on horse or on foot ..from there we see nainital very small n lake in mango shape very nice view n sight scene

title: Good View / Adventure but tiring
review: To visit same one need horse ride .Which become too tiring .

title: Forget the view but enjoy the horse riding - go go go for it
review: The horse riding is superb and sure shot go. Its indeed a thrill to go on top. Dont expect much from view.

title: Best place to enjoy Sunset from LAVA.
review: It's a awesome place to enjoy breathtaking view of setting sun.

title: A lovely trek from my hotel.
review: You can reach this place either by horse riding or through a trek. My wife and I chose the trek and yes we loved it. The trek is about 1.5 kms. The road is steep so it becomes slight tiring. It takes about 45 mins. Please carry water bottles as you wont find anything during the trek. When you reach the tiffin top, the view from there of entire city and the lake is mesmerising. And to add to it at the top you will find small shops selling nestle maggi, tea, coffee etc, which after the trek you will surely love it.

title: Nothing very interesting about it
review: We took a horse ride to this place, but was not overawed about it. The ride itself was very painful to my back as the path is paved with uneven stones.

title: Just Wow
review: This was a breath taking view. We went to this top via Horse Riding (Rs 710/- per horse) which was Dammmmm adventurous through the Rocky mountain narrow trail. On one side its the edge of the Mountain. This Top is also known as Lover;s/ Suicide Point. On the way we saw Chauli ki Jaali (A Rock with a circular Cut in the centre) which has its own Religious importance, Te view from there was just awesome. we can see the Color changing Khurpa Lake from the City along with the City View

title: Tiffin at a TOP .....
review: Ride a HORSE and go to TOP .... of course with TIFFIN and Enjoy Tiffin Top Picnic....... Nice point .... Must Visit

title: Amazing View
review: Dorothy's Seat is the top of the hill accessible with a horse ride or trek where you can view snow covered mountains, nainital and numerous maze of hills in the horizon. Cool wind blows at the top and you feel as if you are in paradise on earth. I would say this is a must visit place to discover more by yourself.

title: Good View from Top
review: to visit tiffin top, one has to go by horses .  way is very narrow to reach this top. I would rather say its scary ,its not in a good condition, horse don't go with the trek and they reach sometime edges of the trek which actually very scary, on sudden you would feel like you fell down . chose day time to visit tiffin top. Make sure to have individual horseman with individual horse. though you will find only a bench their to watch sunset after going thought such scary way . and of course Maggie point.

title: Really good roundabout view
review: This is the top among the surrounding hills and offers a nice view of the town including the lake downstream and the forests around

title: Good... but rising horse ride.
review: Road for horse ride was under construction... so that is little scary.. other wise beautiful view of Naital city and Himalayan snow peaked ranges ... Beautiful experience

title: Don't Miss !
review: Tiffin Top is one of the most visited itinerary in Nainital . This is around 4-6 Km easy/moderate trek and takes approx 4 Hrs ( Includes return ). You can also opt horses for trek if you are not physically fit or any old age person is traveling with you.

title: A mesmerizing view of nainital
review: You can reach there only by horse from lovers point after riding of around 1 hour paying 710/- per horse. This is the last point of horse ride. Reaching there is a tough job for those who don't like horse riding. Coming back from there through Horse is again difficult because of steep.

title: tiffin top
review: tiffin top is the highest pick of the nanitaal .here you can go by hourses only not suggested to older people

title: must visit
review: Its an easy trek which take 3-4hours,horses are available. beautiful view of Naital city and Himalayan snow peaked ranges totalle covered by dense forests.Must visit for nature lovers

title: Tiffin Top
review: great viewing point, the highest pick at nanital.

title: excellent view of the town from Tiffin top.
review: Must visit place if u visit Nainital. You can either trek or take an exciting horse ride to the top. It is worth every effort and penny you spent to be on the top. You'll never forget the view.

title: Super view of Himalayas
review: The acsent is stunning, you can get a bird's eye view of all of Nainital.

title: Worth visit
review: This place is on hill & peak of nainital.you can reach here by horse.there are 3 places on the way.first one is Tiffin top,second Lands end & third one Dorothy seat at top.You can enjoy here horse riding along with nature walk.Horse will charge 700 per person.visit will complete in approx.2 hrs.enjoy ur journey on the way & don't be in hurry to reach at top.Horseman will ask u to give them tip of Rs.100 or more at end of tour.

title: become horse rider
review: to reach tiffin point u need to mount on horse back .. its a thrilling experience one must try.. u will get view of entire  nainital and some part of corbett nation park..

title: Nice View of Himalaya
review: I was thinking that why Ms. Dorothy Kellet chose to be at Tiffin Top which is at about 2300 meter of height. Was it to shape up his famous art pieces... or was she really mesmerized by the beauty of this peak?

title: Excellent view
review: For tiffin top you have to go by horse which itself is very adventurous...you will feel closer to nature and have a great view of himalayas....must visit place

title: Provides good view of nainital
review: This is the Second highest peak of Nainital after China Peak. Its a tourist friendly area. One can go to Tiiffin top by horses or by walking. Its more than 4Km from Nainital ground Its takes 2 hours to go and come back including 1 hour of peak stay. By walking its a bit adventurous and should try going with friend. Tiffin top provides good view of Nainital. Avoid going when there is fog or when the weather is not clear as u will not see anything there.  If u are adventurous and have time try hiking to China peak its worth going there . The view from China Peak is mesmerising.

title: Situated at very high altitude.
review: I was there when my elder son was only one year old and now he is 21. Very calm and beautiful place. Everyone has to see this place. One more attraction, anyone can see whole Nainital from there.

title: amazing
review: the tiffin top is the second highest peak of nainital and the view from there is amazing....the natural beauty of the place is breathtaking...we went there by horses...one must visit this place on their visit to nainital

title: Best place for view downwards
review: Best view of  Mountains and City. Beautiful location and best view of China's Border( as claim by localites)

title: Good view ..
review: Good view, as well as fresh air.  We used horses to visit this place .. Decide for yourself if you wan to walk   .. it can take four hours or so ...

title: Missing it is a Sin
review: Dorothy's seat is an awesome sightseeing location of Nainital. The sight can be reached by horseriding only and not by taxi. You have to take a horse from close to Lover's Point/Suicide point and reach here. The horse will take you to 3-4 points en route and the last destination is Dorothy's seat. From this point you can take a nice panoramic view of Nainital. Amazing place for photography and selfies. You can have snacks and tea from a few shops. A very nice place to enjoy your time and for doing meditation as well.

title: Awesome Place For Adventure Lovers
review: This place has many natural caves where people can have a feel of the early ages of primitive man. You have to go from entry and traverse through the cave and come out of exit. Some of them are even scary (such as Bat cave). Good adventure sport but not advisable for elderly and faint hearted people.

title: Awesome horse ride
review: Horse ride through a dense forest is awesome. Better to visit in off season so that you can enjoy horse ride fully. View from top is amazing with clouds vision

title: Amazing horse ride !
review: Horse riding from base to dorothy seat is a half day activity and must do when visiting Nainital. The horse rates are fixed and i would advise INR 700 package which does the return journey to the top. But this is not for the faint hearted. the route is rocky and muddy so even the horse riding becomes a bit adventorous. The steep route goes through midst of lush green forests giving beautiful viewpoints through the entire journey - the first view point was called Land's end , next Tiffin top and the last dorothy's seat. The best views are from the Dorothy's seat , the highest point of the trip from where you get beautiful views of Nainital lake and the town. Clouds i believe are mostly below you from this point.

title: Good Views of Nainital!
review: Very nice place at a great height. You can go here through a horse-ride (which is very expensive at rs 700 per horse). I think it is worth it as the way passes through good  dense forest

title: Must visit in Nainital
review: There is no better way to explore Nainital than on foot. Tiffin top is at Aryapatta Hill. Altitude: 2292 m. To get here you can drive up to Sherwood College and then continue on a short scenic walk (approx 2-3 hrs walk from city). Got restaurant on top with scenic view. Morning time walk is best & horses are available to climb up to top.

title: Great View.
review: Most people take a horse ride up & a good idea, too.

title: Top it with Tiffin top
review: Reach Tiffin top after a walk from the flats  and be gifted with  a stunning 360 view of Nainital on one side and the cliffs and terai on the other. Ask for the circular road and enhance your walk in the woods, ( in case you are not tired).

title: Trek to tiffin top
review: I reached Nainital and started straight away. I kept my bags at the hotel room ate some snacks. It was around 2 pm in the day. I started walking from masjid in mallital. Its a steep climb and pretty difficult because of the terrain. Tourists can take horses to go to tiffin top but I preferred walking. The hike to the top should take around maximum of two hours. The view from the top is breathtaking. Must do if you are visiting Nainital.

title: Not that great
review: A little over rated. It is one of the few places that the tourist guide will tell you about. A nice picnic spot for a group.

title: Nice place to  visit.
review: To visit this place you need to ride on horse back for hours. But once you reach there it's worth visiting. But choose a good person as a guide.

title: Mar 2014
review: You need to take the cable car to go there queues can be long in the season so get there early beautiful view of the lake . A amusement park on top as well

title: Old time shooting location.
review: As the tittle which I have put says it all. So, I will try to tell other things.

title: Best place for fantastic view
review: No doubt on a clear day it's the best place for a fantastic view of nainital and surroundings. The long waiting for cable car is very irritating

title: Must trek1
review: I you want to see Naini lake from the top, you must trek to come on the north top here. If you can't trek, then hire horse/mule to go there. It becomes enjoyable if you trek there after big snowfall. If lucky, you may get hot tea at the top. Better to carry some energy snacks and water with you.

title: Great View from Tiffin Top
review: Horse ride will cost you 700 odd rupees but a thrilling ride to Tiffin Top. One of the must visit place in your list when you visit Nainital

title: Adventurous, but tiring
review: The only way to reach this place is by taking a horse or walking on a long and unsafe stone road. We had taken a horse and after a long ride to this place, we did not even wait for long. It is not that great a place. Won't miss anything if you don't see this place. The horse ride will cost 700 odd rupees per person and cover this place along with a few other places.

title: Good place for visit
review: Very good place. One can see the nainital town from this place.One can go there by horse. Horse riding I available in less than 10USD. One can recommend to others.

title: Amazing Views
review: This place is ideal to visit at the time of summers as there is much visibility and you can also enjoy the breathtakin views of nainital,like you have never seen before.

title: High end view of Nainital
review: to reach here, you have to take the horse ride, which is the best part of the whole experience; you take horse from Barah Pathar and travel about 4 km along steep mountain and reach here; this is a breathtaking experience; on reaching there, you get a see a panoramic view  of Nainital and surrounding hills

title: Thrilling experience while horse riding to Naina Peak
review: It's great to ride horse while going to Naina Peak. You can hire these horses from Bara Patthar area. This will become your lifetime experience specially going through dense forest and narrow, steep roads. Continuously ups & downs of the jungle road will mesmerize you. Me & my wife, both rode in different horses. It's an awesome experience. Before reaching to Tiffiin Top, you can also visit Lands End (Cliff). Generally horse rider will not take you to the lands ned. You need to force him a bit. There's a small river inside the jungle, and also a meadow type place. Where people can actually go for a picnic. And that's why this name comes. Then go to Top. You can have a whole city view from Top. You can also see Naina Peak from there. Though there's not much at the Top. Don't be in hurry going to the Top. Spend more time through the jungle. And 'm telling you, we enjoyed every moment of it. Don't forget to spend some times at The Lands End. Actually if you include Lands ENd in your trip, then you'll have more time to spend inside the jungle. All together 2 hrs enough for this place. While coming down, horses won't take that much time. They will bring you down through some alternate roads. So, spend more times while reaching to Top. Enjoy every beat of it.

title: Amazing view of the lake
review: we took the horces to this spot which cost us Rs 710 (may 2015), and the ride was amazing, took us about 40 mins to reach the spot- and u can see the full city and a full view of the lake from top. super spot...has a zip line as well which i didnt try..

title: Top of the LAKE CITY
review: You get a superb view of nainital from here. Going on the horse is another thrill. The trail goes through thick jungle, sometimes you can sight a few wild animals

title: A splendid view
review: From Dorothy's Seat, you get a splendid view of the entire town including the world famous Naini Lake. Highly recommended for all visitors to Nainital.

title: real Fun
review: went there with the help of Horses and believe me it was adventurous and sometimes scary (But almost safe).

title: Nice adventure on horse ride
review: we took two horses at Rs.700 each. The rates are fixed . Half way we got down to get clicked in pahari dress. then travelled to Dorothy Seat. On the way is a small ground called Tiffin top . People used to have pcnic there . On the dorothy Seat ther are small restaurants where you can have tea,coldrink etc. .From dorothy Seat you can see the scenic beauty of the mountains.

title: Not worth going here
review: Worst part is- You have to go here through Horse Ride. To make things more worst they charge you Rs.700/- per horse. No value for money. There are plenty of places in Nainital which will give you a beautiful view of city. Spending 700/- bucks for Tiffin Top is not a good deal, more over the horse rider demands for tips.

title: place for trekking
review: Its a best place in Nainital for trekking. I visit there through trekking and enjoyed a lot with my 5 friends.

title: Do Hike Up.
review: Enjoyed a nice hike up here. Like many places here Nainital, you will have some good views. There are also some adventure activities up there like rappelling etc.

title: Breath taking view of Himalayas
review: Tiffin means Packed Food consumed during the day. You have to trek 4 Kms to Tiffin top to enjoy and spend a quiet afternoon. Gives you complete view of Nainital on one side and Himalayan ranges on other side. Nice place to feel the cool breeze.

title: Excellent view from the top!
review: It is a long trek to this place but you can also go by horses.There are only about two restaurants or shops on the top so it is advised to carry your own edibles.But,the breathtaking view from the top,is a nice memory!

title: Trek if possible
review: Please walk to the top instead of taking the horses if possible. You would be able to enjoy the views more this way.

title: Great views
review: We went all the way here on a horse. It was a really nice experience. Cost was Rs600 for the whole horse tour(6 spots) and this was the final stop. Good view of the city

title: Must do
review: We visited Tiffin Top also called Dorothy seat in the month of december.. Hired a horse and took a 1:30 hour round trip.. The way is pretty muddy and slippery but was fun given awesome views on the way..

title: Excellent View !
review: The view from here is excellent, you can see the himalayan range and naina lake from this point. Make sure you carry warm clothes when you visit this point.

title: Good View Point
review: Loved the view from here and enjoyed a good horse ride uphill in Nainital. You can avail a horse ride down from the Flats area and negotiate well with the horse men , they will take you around all the major view points and tourist spots in Nainital.

title: Enjoy the pleasant climb through the woods.
review: Tiffin top or Dorothy’s seat is a small circular stage made of stone, perched atop at a height of 2210 meters above sea level built in memory of an English lady Mrs Kellet Dorothy.A short trek of about 4 km to the top of the cliff gives way to an excellent view of the Himalyan ranges and of Nainital town.This spot is a must visit for artists, photographers and nature enthusiast.

title: Go for a view
review: Definitely should be included in places to cover. However,take horses to climb only if you are are short of time. If you have ample time (3-4 hrs) and little stamina, I'll recommend trekking up on foot so that you can enjoy the views as much and as long as you want and are not bogged to quickly leave. It's a beautiful trek, route is well marked surrounded with tall oak trees.

title: Enjoy the horseride!
review: I was extremely excited to go on a horse ride up the hill.My horse had a funny name Pawan. We were three people and each one of us enjoyed the ride.the horsemen take you to the top.Coming down is a bit tiring owing to the rocky path.Once you reach the top,the scenic beauty will be a mesmerizing experience for you!

title: Worth the horse ride
review: Take the full trip of the horse ride (cost around 700 Rs), see the pic. Of course u can also go by walk. The horse ride is a great fun allowing you the beautiful view around and also little adventurous. If you have back pain or  arthritic then it would be better to avoid. the full horse ride takes you to Dorothy seat then Tiifin top, then the peak. There would be stops for u to enjoy the view.

title: Excellent birds eye view
review: This place has an awesome view of both the lake and the himalayans in the same line along side with the top view of Rajbhavan, the golf course and almost everything at Nainital.

title: very good place
review: it is one of the best place in nainital. yous should plan to go there. you hire a horse to go there coz there is only one option to go there. from tiffin top you can view whole nainital from the very top of the hill. also you can view some boarding schools from there

title: Nice walk and view
review: A pleasant climb through woods. A bit steep if you are not very fit, but otherwise not too difficult (you can also get a pony to take you up). There are good, though slightly obscured views back down. Definitely worth climbing up here, but if you have the time then also make the effort to climb Naina Peak on the opposite side of town as the views of the lake are much better and you also see the Himalayas.

title: Good view
review: Nice place. Must take the horse ride otherwise its not worth the effort. Very picturesque view from the view point. Though the horse ride is a little risky but defo worth it.

title: Horse Ride to Tiffin top
review: The Horse Ride to Tiffin Top is exhilarating and also adventurous.

title: A place to Trek to
review: Gives you complete view of Nainital on one side and Himalayan ranges on other side.

title: Nice Horse ride, **KOI MIL GAYAA** shot en route
review: It is a stonework picnic perch built as memorial to British Army officer's wife Dorothy Kellet by her husband Col JP Kellet; after her death from septicaemia aboard a ship bound for England. She was buried en-route at Red sea in 1936.

title: seat
review: its a nice view from there, there is a ground nearby where the kids can play & adults can relax... keep in mind if u travel on horse back u get limited time to urself....

title: place to feel the breeze
review: nice place to feel the cool breeze... you can see the city down from there....

title: Breathtaking view
review: Nice tourist spot....the horse ride to that spot is also very thrilling !!

title: Enchanting view
review: Another beautiful point from where you can see around Nainital with the Himalayas in the background. You can climb to this point by foot or by horses. The beauty of this point is something you need to experience.

title: Enjoy Horseride and spring
review: Any hill station offers you just weather rest of the things are just to stick around. Activities like horse riding, shooting, games n all are just business activities.. So enjoy the weather..

title: Tiffin Top
review: Like all Hill Stations , a Sight Seeing and Horse Riding Destination.

title: Highest Point of Nainital...
review: Travelled to Tiffin top on a horse and was a unique experience... the view on the way and visit to Land's end was a excellent view.. Dorothy's seat derives its name from an English woman of the same name who died here when she fell into the valley from this spot... an excellent view of the entire nainital valley is worth the travel...

title: Very Very crowded with Shops !!
review: A market on the "Tiffin Top", nothing else, very disappointing, not at all recommended, only food stalls :(

title: Little scary but most memorable visit  ti
review: Dorothy's seat or more popularly known as Tiffin Top is possibly the best attraction in Nainital. Hats off to our car driver who suggested this little gem.

title: awesome view...
review: you have to go either with the rope way or horse ride...I chose rope way...very nice view from the tiffin top..

title: TIFFIN TOP : WHAT A VIEW
review: Went to this area on Horses.

title: Walk instead of taking a horse
review: Although, its supposed to be traveled by a horse, you can walk to this place in about 45 mins. The view from this place is awesome, you get to see the famous Sherwood, Raj Bhawan etc. Must Walk.

title: Beware of Touts
review: Very bad experience, and not at all worth visiting. Beware of touts (Even the Taxi driver is a part of this) who charge double/triple the stipulated horse-ride fee. Instead visit the Mall road and take a Ropeway to Snow-view point.

title: Breathtaking views..
review: We took the horse riding tour to the top.. it was quite enjoyable. . The view of Nainital from this point is amazing. . It is a photographer's delight !

title: Awesome view .... can see entire Nainital from here !
review: We took the horses from Barapathar and reached Dorothy seat... and believe me it was an awesome view from this location. You can see the entire Nainital city from here include the long beautiful lake.

title: Nice view from Top
review: There are two ways to reach this place.

title: Horse Ride..
review: It is top point of Nainital...that's all...nothing special..if you love horse ride..then enjoy...In season you have to pay Rs 600 per horse and off season Rs 300..negotiate..

title: really a top
review: Horse ride to go to this place is good and is a life time experience.Passing through lush green jungle is really tough on us and horse as well. Brilliant View's available. Worth going.

title: Time waste and very risky horse ride
review: its all about 1.5 hrs risky horse ride , local guides and taxi-drivers force you to see the place with all sort of stories about the film shooting and jungle safari , of which many of the stories are pure lie , they think tourists are dumb to believe all those stories..

title: DEADLY & HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
review: I would never suggest anyone to go up the mountain by riding horses. We were 5 people and chose horse riding. Earlier horsemen agreed to send 1person with each horse but when we started going up, we saw there was only 1 little boy with 3 horses which most risky thing as horses intend to move alone. They even gave 1 ill horse, and after about 10-15 min journey , that horse fell. He actually died which made our situation more critical. It was only by gods grace that horse fell the other side and not in the ditch. After that we chose to come down ourself walking the deadly way.

title: fantastic view
review: This  is a very enjoyable track .I climbed from  Mallital flat and came back from another route to  Horse stand.There is a b;ful forest  on the way.The labour  of climbing is well rewarded by a panoramic view of lake and the  hills .Clouds float in the  sky and one does not want to come back.not much crowded one could do meditation.Pity is  that track is not in good shape and  need repairs.Some eating joints provide tea and snacks.

title: Splendid View
review: Good horse ride to the top.The way is also beautiful with forest on the side. Clouds floating in the sky can be seen once on the top.Not very crowded place. The track needs repair. Worth visiting.

title: Nothing much exciting
review: visited tiffin top by horse with my family.

title: Apart from the view... nothing much to speak about
review: The view from Dorothy's Seat is amazing. The winds are quite strong there and if you ever go there make sure you have plenty of warm clothes.

title: Breathtaking view..
review: Breathtaking view..Do stop for some snaps..Take a cab for sightseeing and prep for a roller coaster ride if u'd like sit in the front seat.. :)

title: ride on horses
review: Make sure there is one attendant for each horse if you are travelling in a group, as there are a lot of scrupulous agents out there. The path is a tough one for the horses and more tougher for you if you are riding it. The route takes you to different viewpoints before converging near barapathar.

title: Amazing View
review: The tiffin top is one the best to look at nainital from the top.. the 5 km trek to the top from the mall road takes time but it is worth it

title: Worth watch..
review: Tiffin Top also known as Dorothy's Seat This terraced hill top (2,292 m (7,520 ft)) on Ayarpatta hill is a 4 km (2.5 mi) hike from the town centre and commands a nice view of the neighbouring country side. Dorothy's Seat is a stonework picnic perch on Tiffin Top built as a memorial to a British Army Officer's wife, Dorothy Kellet, by her husband Col J.P. Kellett DSO MC, City of London Regiment, and admirers after her death from septicaemia aboard a ship bound for England to be with her 4 children, Elizabeth, Joan, Barbara and Richard. She was buried at sea in The Red Sea in 1936.

title: Amazing views after courageous horse ride
review: The Dorothy's Seat can be reached only by walk or by riding a horse. The horse ride takes about an hour and it takes your breath away when the horse takes you through narrow and hilly tracks. You feel like reaching a heaven once you reach at the top. The views around are simply amazing.The freshness of air just sooths your heart. It is a must visit place for those who can dare a 2 hours horse ride

title: Go by horse
review: Took a horse ride to Tiffin Top. Poor horses, some struggled under the weight of us larger sized Americans. Fun experience. Great view of the lake below. Not too much to do at the top.

title: amazing view
review: Breathtaking view.Do stop for some snaps with ur family and Take a cab for sightseeing and prepare for a roller coaster ride if u'd like sit in the front seat.

title: Best point
review: A good hour and half spent on a horse ride to Dorothy's seat. The trek on horses was worth it amidst the woods on the hills. Shade breeze and woods. Excellent view of nainital lAke and town from the top. Best spot of nainital. The horse riders charge a lot but bargain. Started from 500 ended up around 300, worth the effort on their part. U can also do some adventure sport up there. Recommended

title: good view point...of nainital
review: A hitch hike on the horse back....the ride towards the tiffin top has to be undertake on horse back...the charges may vary according to your bargaining powers...we ended up paying 650.00 per head. though it was Off season (March end).

title: Top of the World- Awesome View
review: We decided to trek to the Tiffin Top via Thandi Sadak after visiting Naina Devi Temple. Though we didn't have idea about the exact direction but kept on asking people on the way and managed to reach Sherwood after about 50 minutes of steep trek/climb but on the cemented paths. From there it took us good 30 minutes more to reach there but the climb and the hard work was worth it. It has awesome view of the entire Nainital specially the lake and the surroundings were beautiful.

title: Breathtaking experience!
review: First things first: Make sure you walk up to the Tiffin Top!! The true worth and beauty of this place can only be realised if you walk up the stretch! The entire stretch is around 5-6 kms of walking up and getting down to the same point - Bara Patthar. (Not advised for elder people or groups with kids).

title: beautiful
review: ride the horse uphill and hike it down the lake looks beautiful from there like a mango....its truly a birds eye view of the beautiful lake & mountains

title: trek 1.5 hours with nature, wildlife, himalayan hills, mango shape lake etc
review: if you are going to Nainital / Uttrakhand tour package / Holiday package for Uttrakhand & love to trek so must visit Tiffin Top. Trek 1.5 hours with nature, wildlife, himalayan hills, mango shape lake etc. Once had a trekking & wildlife tour including Nainital & we enjoyed a lot. Stay with nature, peace, relaxation in Nainital. Thanks a lot our Travel Agent Mr. Manas (Book Car in Delhi dot Com) & his all team for personalize trip to Uttrakhand.

title: very nice
review: have a fun with playing station, views, food, cable car, nice view of naini lake and other part of nainital. visit the place for sure

title: A Blissful Experience
review: Dorothy Seat in the beautiful lake hillstation of Naini Tal in Uttarakhand is popularly known as 'Tiffin Top' by the locals and guides. Its the highest spot in Naini Tal and the winding road up to the spot is worth the trek and if you have difficulty in walking then take a horse.

title: View of the snow covered peaks of the Himalayan range.
review: Access is only on horse back.  Care should be exercised in not falling into the trap of the horse guys who quote mind boggling rates for the horse ride.  There are no published rates and the rate card which they display is all cooked up...had to bargain before we finally took up their offer.  The ride up is through steep tracks which are not well maintained, nor the horses well maintained..the saddle was slipping quite often and the horse shoes were missing as the horse tended to walk with a tilt.  Once you reach the peak the view is spectacular and the tension dissipates till the ride back to the base.

title: The view is awesome!!
review: The view of Nainital from Dorothy's seat is awesome. But beware as reaching here can be troublesome. You either need to hike 7-8 kms or take a horse ride to the top through narrow dangerous road. Not everyone will like the horse ride so decide wisely. Be careful with the price rate for the horse ride as the priced shown there are too high. You can get the horse ride at a rate from Rs. 325 per person to Rs.425 per person depending on the season.

title: Great Place
review: From Lovers point one can hire horse charges around Rs. 500 per person this will take around 2 hours for complete trip. This is worth to experience
